page.title: 09Gardens of Pleasure
page.content: We walked down the road to St Anne's Wells Gardens. Near a clump of trees there was a lady feeding squirrels which were grey with light orange patches on their legs. They scampered round us and took food from our hands. Pigeons and sparrows fluttered around. Near by was a playground with a large sandpit, a slide, four swings and a climbing frame. People were on the tennis courts and the bowling green or having coffee in a cafe. I eenjoyed the Garden for the Blind most. The notices were in Braille. The garden was full of scented flowers and bushes. We went to see the pond and goldfish and some uge lily leaves. Then we made our way back to school listening to the birds singing and the leaves rustling from the many different kinds of trees.
